intro: Haberlea pinnata, commonly known as the Cape rosebay, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It is a member of the Aizoaceae family, commonly referred to as the ice plant family. The plant is characterized by its succulent, fleshy leaves and clusters of bright yellow flowers that bloom in spring. It thrives in well-drained soil and full sun, making it a popular choice for rock gardens. Due to its unique appearance and adaptability, it is often cultivated for ornamental purposes.
